com.unitedcaterers.serverwithoutlockcookie

Class ClientProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.unitedcaterers.serverwithoutlockcookie.ClientProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataBase, UCServer, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ClientProxy
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements UCServer, DataBase, java.io.Serializable
    This is a client proxy object that is instantiated on the server side for every client. The purpose of this object is to uniquely identify the client so that only the client that has locked the row is able to unlock it.

    Notice that it is very similar to UCServerImpl class in com.unitedcaterers.server package. The differences are -
    1. ClientProxy implements UCServerInterface as well as Database interface. The purpose of implementing UCServerInterface is to allow the clients to invoke higher level business methods (which is same as UCServerImpl), while the purpose of implementing DataBase interface is to satify the requirement of the assignment to expose methods of DataBase class to the client.
    2. ClientProxy does not instantiate DataBaseImpl. RMIUCServerImpl sets ClientProxy's DataBase reference using ClientProxy.setDataBase() method, which is a static method.

    We have chosen to have our client use the UCServerInterface so that the client does not have to worry about locking/unlocking.
    3. ClientProxy maintains an ArrayList of the records locked by the client it represents. If a client tries to unlock a record that it hasn't locked, it throws a SecurtiyException. In case of com.unitedcaterers.server.UCServerImpl, this functionality is directly implemented using lock cookie.

    In your project, you have to make a decision whether you want to the client to call lower level Database methods or higher level UCServerInterface methods. You can implement the client either way. If you use the use the lower level DataBase interface methods, you can get rid of the UCServerInterface altogether.

    Our recommendation is to not use this approach at all. Identifying clients without lock cookie by maintaining a client proxy on the server is an inefficient way and defeats the whole purpose of creating a stateless service. So we recommend to modify the signature of the lock/unlock methods and use the approach implemented in com.unitedcaterers.server package, where UCServer exposes only the business methods to the clients.
    See Also:

      • findAndReturnData

        public java.lang.String[][] findAndReturnData(java.lang.String[] criteria)
                                       throws UCException
        This is an additional method (not specified in the DataBase interface) that is very useful for the application. It returns the actual data in String[][] format instead of just the record numbers that match the given criteria. The first value of the String[] is the record number the rest are the fields.
        Parameters:
        criteria - A string array of same length as the number of fields.
        Returns:
        An array of String arrays containing record data.
        Throws:
        UCException

      • find

        public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
        Description copied from interface: DataBase
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Queen" matches "Queen" or "Queens".)
        Specified by:
        find in interface DataBase
        Parameters:
        criteria - The values that need to be searched.
        Returns:
        all the record numbers that match the criteria

      • lock

        public java.lang.String lock(int recNo)
                      throws RecordNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: DataBase
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a string (lockkey) that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface DataBase
        Parameters:
        recNo - The record to be locked.
        Returns:
        A Lock Key that should be used in subsequent calls to update, unlock, or delete.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException

          java.lang.String lockkey)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   SecurityException
        Description copied from interface: DataBase
        Releases the lock on a record. lockkey must be the key that was returned when the record was locked; otherwise it throws SecurityException.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface DataBase
        Parameters:
        recNo - The record to be unlocked.
        lockkey - The key that was used to lock the record.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException
